qas.question: What did the foundation announce in November 2014

answers.text: In November 2014, the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation announced that they are adopting an open access (OA) policy for publications and data

qas.question: What does the OA policy for publications and data do ?

answers.text: open access (OA) policy for publications and data, "to enable the unrestricted access and reuse of all peer-reviewed published research funded by the foundation

qas.question: What does the OA policy cover ?

answers.text: As of January 1, 2015 their Open Access policy is effective for all new agreements.

qas.question: In what year did Bill and Melinda Gates adopt open access policy for capacity building and knowledge sharing?

plausible_answers.text: As of January 1, 2015 their Open Access policy is effective for all new agreements.

qas.question: What does the new agreement policy cover?

plausible_answers.text: to enable the unrestricted access and reuse of all peer-reviewed published research funded by the foundation, including any underlying data sets

qas.question: What does the OA policy for data sets do?
What is the most applauded among similar policies?
When is the publication and data policy effective for new agreements?

context: <a0_0>In <b3_0>November 2014<b3_0/>, the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation announced that they are adopting an <a1_0><b6_0>open access (OA) policy<b6_0/> for publications and data<a0_0/>, "<b5_0>to enable the unrestricted access and reuse of all peer-reviewed published research funded by the foundation<a1_0/>, including any underlying data sets<b5_0/>". This move has been widely applauded by those who are working in the area of capacity building and knowledge sharing.[citation needed] Its terms have been called the most stringent among similar OA policies. <a2_0><b4_0><b7_0>As of January 1, 2015<b7_0/> their Open Access policy is effective for all new agreements.
